Those are all good points, and yes, intercepting weaponfire is realistic in some situations. However, before it was outlawed, almost every missile and laser got destroyed before even getting halway to its target. I think about 5% of all the missiles fired hit (that's 5 per every 100), and we had people destroying laser shots with missile explosions and everything. Seeing that, the council made a rule that interception of weaponfire is illegal. This might be a bit unrealistic, but its more realistic than every shot being destroyed.

However, as unrealistic as it might be, it is still a rule. Characters might be able to destroy weapons story-wise, but not legally in the RPG. Even if there's a good reason for it, its still currently illegal. The council will (and we have already to an extent) reconsider that rule and modify it, but it was neccessary when we made it, and its still in effect. Even if its reasonable to block a shot at the moment, the rule must still be followed until its changed.

Arguing against it isn't bad, but not following it is. So until its changed, its not just a good idea, its the law. *buckles his seatbelt*
